level.heading: Community Health Care Financing Fund; establishment, purpose.

level.text: There is hereby established within the General Fund a special nonlapsing interest earning account to be designated as the Community Health Care Financing Fund ("Fund"), into which the Chief Financial Officer shall deposit all:
Proceeds received by the District from the sale by the District of Columbia Tobacco Settlement Financing Corporation of its Tobacco Settlement Asset-Backed Bonds, Series 2006;
Receipts from any fees and taxes specifically identified by District law to be paid into the Fund;
All payments received from Greater Southeast Investment, L.P., relating to its loans of approximately $49 million to Specialty Hospitals of America, LLC, or certain of its subsidiaries; and
The District's share of any proceeds arising from a disposition of all or any part of the land and improvements on Lots 3 and 4, Square 5919.

The purposes of the Fund shall be to directly pay to promote health care and for the delivery of health care related services in the District, including the construction of health care facilities and the operation of health care related programs, or to reimburse any account of the General Fund for its expenditures for these purposes.
All interest generated by the Fund shall be retained by the Fund.

level.heading: Section References
level.text: This section is referenced in § 7-1932 and § 47-2402.01.

level.text: D.C. Law 17-186, in subsec. (a), deleted "and" from the end of par. (1), substituted a semicolon for a period at the end of par. (2), and added pars. (3) and (4).

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 16-288
level.text: Law 16-288, the "Community Access to Health Care Amendment Act of 2006", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 16-913, which was referred to Committee on Human Services. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on November 14, 2006, and December 5, 2006, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on December 28, 2006, it was assigned Act No. 16-647 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 16-288 became effective on March 14, 2007.

level.heading: Legislative History of Law 17-186
level.text: Law 17-186, the "East of the River Hospital Revitalization Tax Exemption Amendment Act of 2008", was introduced in Council and assigned Bill No. 17-464 which was referred to the Committee on Finance and Revenue. The Bill was adopted on first and second readings on April 1, 2008, and May 6, 2008, respectively. Signed by the Mayor on May 20, 2008, it was assigned Act No. 17-380 and transmitted to both Houses of Congress for its review. D.C. Law 17-186 became effective on July 18, 2008.

level.heading: Short Title
level.text: Short title: Section 10021 of D.C. Law 19-21 provided that subtitle C of title X of the act may be cited as "Special Purpose Fund Transfer Act of 2011".

level.heading: Delegation of Authority
level.text: Delegation of Authority pursuant to D.C. Law 16-288, the Community Access to Health Amendment Act of 2006, see Mayor's Order 2007-82, April 2, 2007 (54 DCR 7811).

level.heading: Editor's Notes
level.text: Section 10022 of D.C. Law 19-21 provided: "Sec. 10022. Notwithstanding any provision of law limiting the use of funds in the Community Health Care Financing Fund established by section 101 of the Community Access to Health Care Omnibus Amendment Act of 2006, effective March 14, 2007 (D.C. Law 16-288; D.C. Official Code § 7-1931), the Chief Financial Officer shall transfer, from the certified resources of the Community Health Care Financing Fund, to the unrestricted fund balance of the General Fund, and recognize as revenue in fiscal year 2012, $5.126 million."
